data.title: Accessibility
data.meta_description: At ASU Gammage, we prioritize the accessibility of our performances and facilities to ensure all patrons can fully enjoy their experience. If you have any inquiries, recommendations, or require assistance regarding accessibility, please don't hesitate to reach out to us via email.
data.text:
Accessible seating is available at various price levels on the main floor including limited mobility, wheel chair transfer, wheel chair spaces and companion seats. Specific seating options and locations are available on the seating map at www.ticketmaster.com for each event or by calling the Box Office at 480-965-3434 or email at boxoffice@asugammage.com. The front accessible seats are accessed by an elevator in the North lobby. There are elevators on either side of the building allowing access to all levels of the venue, however there are not accessible seating areas on the upper levels.

ASU Gammage offers reserved parking spaces for patrons with disabilities.

Accessible parking is available in all parking areas. For accessible seating located in the front of the Orchestra section, please plan to enter on the North side entrance for elevator access. Dedicated accessible spaces are held in the Gammage Lot. When those accessible spaces are full, there are designated drop off areas at both theater entrances. You may drop off members of your party, and then park your car at the Maroon Garage (Apache Structure).

ASU Gammage has sound enhancement equipment available at hat check areas for patrons with hearing impairments.

Sound equipment should be checked out prior to the performance.

We have a few tips and tricks for the best experience:

• While headphones are available at ASU Gammage, we HIGHLY suggest bringing in your favorite pair to use with the sound equipment. All standard headphones work with our system!

• Hearing aids containing a small, copper wire called a telecoil are compatible—ask a staff member for more details.

• The volume is adjustable on our new system. Take some time and find the volume that works best for you!

As a service for people with hearing loss ASU Gammage is equipped with GalaPro. GalaPro provides open captioning for most of our touring Broadway Shows. It uses a text display to provide a simultaneous translation of dialogue and lyrics during a live performance. The service is open to everyone and is visible via the GalaPro App on your smart phone or via tablet which you may check out at our Hat Check rooms. GalaPro may be downloaded via your phone’s App store.

More information on Gala Pro

Courtesy wheelchairs are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. Courtesy wheelchairs must be checked out and returned to either Hat Check room. Courtesy wheelchairs may be used to transport guests to and from each floor of the theater.

Please note that staff members are not able to assist patrons in transferring to or from a wheelchair, theater seat or vehicle; operate motorized mobility aids such as scooters and Segways; or provide personal attendant services such as assisting patrons in the restroom, with taking medications, or similar activities.

Mobility aids that cannot be stored safely within a patron's immediate seating area will be stored outside the house as close as possible to a patron's seat. At intermission and post show, ushers make every effort to check in with patrons who may need assistance in accessing their stored mobility aids.
